summary:
As a Ph.D agronomist I have 25 years of experience with rural development in Africa (and a bit in the Caribbean). At the start of  this period I was mainly engaged in participatory, adaptive, agricultural research on farmers’ fields and in extension related activities. Later on I also got experience with facilitating multi-stakeholder processes, with capacity building for efficient agricultural services, especially research and extension, with reviewing the agronomic aspects of several large-scale, private rice farms, with a mid-term evaluation of a cotton value chain project and with a large scale rice producer survey. More recently I was mainly involved in project coordination and other management functions.

Key qualifications:  Participatory methods (PTD, PRA, FFS), Agricultural Research and Extension, Project Management (formulation, planning, coordination, evaluation), Rice cultivation (rainfed, irrigated), Rice Value Chains (small-, medium-, large-scale productions), Cotton cultivation and Value Chains, Integrated Soil Fertility Management, Capacity Building, Multi-Stakeholder Processes, Household surveys.
